snippet: The leader of the Nusra Front sought to end deadly violence among rebels as the United Nations reported progress on the purge of chemical weapons from Syria.
abstract: Abu Mohammed al-Jolani, leader of Nusra Front, Al Qaeda affiliate in Syria, proposes initiative aimed at halting deadly infighting between armed opponents of Pres Bashar al-Assad; proposal calls for cease-fire and establishment of Islamic court to handle disputes between Nusra and the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria, or ISIS.

byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD and ANNE BARNARD
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad and Mohammad Ghannam from Beirut, Karam Shoumali from Istanbul, Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: The leader of the Nusra Front sought to end deadly violence among rebels as the United Nations reported progress on the purge of chemical weapons from Syria.

headline.main: Qaeda Group Leader in Syria Suggests Islamic Court to End Rebel Infighting
headline.print_headline: Qaeda Group Leader in Syria Suggests Islamic Court to End Rebel Infighting
